 maps.|thumb|350px|right]]

There are some 120 to 175 languages in the Philippines, depending on the method
of classification. Four others are no longer
spoken. Almost all are Malayo-Polynesian languages. Two are official while (as
of 2010) twelve are official auxiliary languages. The regional languages are
the auxiliary official languages in the regions and shall serve as auxiliary
media of instruction therein... Article XIV Section 7.
